[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Method: get_label_values()] [Cardinality Explosion] Can attackers create unlimited unique combinations of label values through get_label_values() to cause cardinality explosions in time-series databases, leading to storage exhaustion and query performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Method: get_label_values()] [Order Dependency] The comment mentions order must match metrics.rs - can a mismatch in label order between get_label_values() and metrics.rs cause incorrect metric attribution, allowing attackers to frame other applications for their malicious activity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Method: get_label_values()] [Reference Lifetime] Does get_label_values() return string references that could lead to use-after-free vulnerabilities if the underlying IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata is dropped while labels are still in use? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Method: get_label_values()] [Unicode Exploitation] Can unicode characters or special characters in label values returned by get_label_values() break metric parsers, cause rendering issues, or enable injection attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [Cross-Field Consistency] Can attackers provide inconsistent values across request_identifier_type, request_identifier, request_email, and request_application_name fields to bypass validation logic that checks each field independently but not their relationships? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [Processor Name Spoofing] Can malicious clients set processor_name to match trusted system processors, causing their requests to be processed with elevated privileges or bypass rate limits intended for untrusted processors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [Connection ID Manipulation] Can attackers manipulate request_connection_id to hijack existing connections, bypass connection-level rate limits, or cause connection state corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [Serde Vulnerabilities] Can crafted serialized data exploit known Serde vulnerabilities (e.g., cyclic references, stack overflow) when deserializing IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata from untrusted sources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [JSON Injection] If IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata is serialized to JSON for logging or storage, can attackers inject JSON control characters to break out of the intended structure and manipulate logs or configuration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [Binary Serialization Attack] If using binary serialization formats, can attackers craft malicious binary payloads that deserialize to unexpected types or cause memory corruption when creating IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constants: API Gateway Headers] [Gateway Misconfiguration] Can mismatches between expected API Gateway headers (from the linked api-gateway repo) and actual implementation cause authentication bypass if the gateway and indexer disagree on header names? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constants: API Gateway Headers] [Header Forwarding Attack] Can attackers exploit header forwarding behavior where API Gateway headers are trusted without re-validation, allowing malicious proxies to inject arbitrary values into x-aptos-* headers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constants: API Gateway Headers] [Version Mismatch] Can version mismatches between the api-gateway repo and indexer-grpc cause security issues if header definitions diverge, leading to authentication bypass or authorization failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constant: MESSAGE_SIZE_LIMIT] [Usize Overflow] Can the MESSAGE_SIZE_LIMIT calculation (1024 * 1024 * 15) overflow on platforms where usize is smaller than expected, causing incorrect size limits and security vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [String Safety] Are String fields in IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata validated for UTF-8 correctness, or can invalid UTF-8 sequences cause panics, undefined behavior, or bypass string-based security checks? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Method: get_label_values()] [Lifetime Issues] Can lifetime annotation issues in get_label_values() cause dangling references if the returned Vec<&str> outlives the IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata instance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata] [Thread Safety] Is IndexerGrpcRequestMetadata safe to share across threads? Can concurrent access to its fields without proper synchronization cause data races or inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constant: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_FILESTORE_THREADS] [TOCTOU Race] Can Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use races occur when checking MAXIMUM_NUMBER_FILESTORE_THREADS limits, allowing more threads to be created than intended during concurrent allocation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constants: All Headers] [Case Sensitivity] Are GRPC header comparisons case-sensitive or case-insensitive? Can attackers bypass header validation by using different case combinations (X-Aptos-Data-Authorization vs x-aptos-data-authorization)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constants: All Headers] [Header Duplication] What happens if multiple instances of the same header (e.g., multiple x-aptos-identifier headers) are present? Can this cause ambiguity, bypass validation, or cause processing inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/constants.rs] [Constant: MESSAGE_SIZE_LIMIT] [Boundary Condition] Can messages exactly at the MESSAGE_SIZE_LIMIT boundary (15MB) trigger off-by-one errors in buffer allocation or validation logic, causing overflows or underflows?
